title: Assamese language
summary: Assamese (/ˌæsəˈmiːz/[4]), also Asamiya ([ɔ̞ˈx̟omia] অসমীয়া),[5] is an Indo-Aryan language spoken mainly in the northeast Indian state of Assam, where it is an official language. It is the easternmost Indo-European language, spoken by over 23 million speakers,[1] and serves as lingua franca of the region.[6]
